name: Ramada Fredericton

reviews.text: Old Hotel, small rooms. Family suite is a joke. One big room with 2 beds and a pullout couch. Very small fridge and microwave. Bathroom with huge square tub (more for couples then a family) and a tiny tiny tiny shower hidden behind the bathroom door. Not worth the money they gouge you for. The people are very friendly and willing to help. It's just too bad these rooms need so much help. Stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Hotel does not live up to it's Name!!

reviews.text: I enjoy Ramada Inn. The staff always treat me with respect.. I always stay there when in that area of Fredericton.
reviews.title: I enjoy Ramada Inn. The staff always treat me with...

reviews.text: I immediately found the mini fridge tucked away in the dresser but the microwave was nowhere to be seen.
reviews.title: Where's the microwave?

reviews.text: Other amenities such as iron and board, coffee maker, hair blower were readily available.
reviews.title: 2ND STAY AT THE RAMADA FREDERICTON

reviews.text: Missing also, was a breakfast but the hotel's own restaurant was available ($).
reviews.title: Awesome satff !!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Ramada Fredericton in July 2013. For starters, the hotel is located on the northside of the St. John River, a fair distance from downtown. The hotel is somewhat older but in fairly good condition, likely kept this way by a noticeably attentive staff and dedicated maintenance team. At the hotel's center is a pool/courtyard area. In my own opinion, much of this space appears to be wasted on what appears to be past expectations. The hotel might be better to tear up much of the courtyard (including the pond?) in favor of expanding the pool/water amenities (water slide?). While the hotel makes mention of "renovations", it is apparent that they have made some updates to the bathroom vanities, bedding and some room amenities (TVs) but the decor of the hotel still remains to be that of a hotel of the late 1980s/1990s. While the rooms are clean and the bedding was spotless, there are subtle reminders of the hotels age such as the lighting, bath/shower and room climate control (or lack there of). The onsite conference rooms were clean, adequate and in a central location. The onsite restaurant “The Courtyard” offers good food from a decent menu. If there was one thing that stood out, it was the exceptional staff: the front desk was very friendly (Jillian) and the staff supporting the conference area was quick and prompt. There were many positives but it is worth mentioning that I found the exterior noises to easily find their way into my room, such as kids in the courtyard/pool or a dog in the adjoining room. Aagain, perhaps better room climate control might help drowned out the noise. While I can recommend the hotel, it would be nice to see so additional renovations.
reviews.title: Fair Stay in Fredericton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in an upgraded room and even had a plaque showing 'business class'.
reviews.title: Staff nice - location bad - hotel needs a lot of work!

reviews.text: The hotel itself is outdated and needs a lot of renovations - seems to be more of a place that hockey teams/families will stay but not a place for couples looking for R&R.
reviews.title: Not that great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is terrible - it is not hear anything but a gas station - you cannot walk anywhere.
reviews.title: Poor Experience

reviews.text: The staff were very nice and accomodating. The bartender let us stay a little later to have a few drinks since it was the only bar/restaurant close by.
reviews.title: Bucking the trend

description: Complimentary wireless, Flat Screen TV's, pillowtop mattresses, full service restaurant and terrace bar. Minutes to downtown. Fitness room, pool tables and games area. Executive rooms with King Bed Suite with King Sleigh Bed and stand-alone bathtub, heated bathroom floor and TV in the bathroom in this suite.Adjacent to a 9 Hole Golf Course with mini-putt, our Meditteranean ambiance in the beautiful 10,000 square foot indoor courtyard allows for summer all year long.
